text: László Bárczay (21 February 1936 – 7 April 2016) was a Hungarian chess Grandmaster.Bárczay László (1936–2016) In 1966 he was awarded the FIDE International Master title. At the 1966 Olympiad in Havana, he scored 11/12 (ten wins and two draws) as second reserve for the bronze medal-winning Hungarian team, winning the individual gold medal for sixth board.László Bárczay Chess Olympiad Record at olimpbase.org, Retrieved 24 March 2013 In 1967 he was awarded the Grandmaster title. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Hungarian chess players Category:Chess grandmasters
title: László Bárczay
